articles.title: Trump lectured about nationalism, in Paris
articles.description: President Trump was in Paris Sunday and was lectured by a key ally about the dangers of nationalism – plus, he had a brief encounter with Russian President Vladimir Putin. Weijia Jiang reports.

articles.title: "CBS Weekend News" headlines for Sunday, November 11, 2018
articles.description: Here's a look at the top stories making headlines on the "CBS Weekend News" with DeMarco Morgan.

articles.title: Strong winds, dry brush fuel California wildfires
articles.description: The combination of powerful winds and brittle trees and shrubs whipped up another day of blowtorch conditions in the California fire zones. Some 250,000 people have been chased from their homes by two large fires in Southern California. The death toll has jum…

articles.author: Brit McCandless Farmer
articles.title: Looking for life on Mars — at the bottom of a gold mine
articles.description: Two miles below Earth's surface, scientists found animal life in a South African gold mine. They wonder: If life can exist there, could it exist on Mars?
articles.content: Deep in the South African gold mines that line the Vaal River basin, an international team of scientists, including Belgian biologist Gaetan Borgonie, are looking for what they call extreme life—life where no one believed it could exist. The gold mines are th… [+2724 chars]

articles.author: Brit McCandless Farmer
articles.title: Shaquem and Shaquill Griffin's pact
articles.description: Twins and Seattle Seahawk teammates, the brothers made a pledge as children that has impacted their lives ever since. So what did they promise?
articles.content: Eight-year-olds can say a lot of things they don't mean. But when twins Shaquem and Shaquill Griffin were that age, they were very serious about a pact they made. They agreed that, when they grew up, they would live together, marry twins, have children, and r… [+4008 chars]

articles.title: What cabinet departures should we be watching for?
articles.description: Dan Balz, Rachael Bade, Mark Landler, and Ed O’Keefe discuss the midterm races that have yet to be called and how the record number of women entering Congress will affect Capitol Hill.

articles.title: Florida recount progresses amid sky-high tensions
articles.description: President Trump tweeted without evidence Saturday that elections were being stolen
articles.content: FORT LAUDERDALE, Fla. — The first election workers are recounting ballots Sunday in Florida's bitterly close races for the U.S. Senate and governor, ramping up their efforts after the secretary of state ordered a review of the two nationally watched contests.… [+4553 chars]

articles.title: Air traffic controller heard slurring her words
articles.description: Federal and airport authorities are investigating why an air traffic controller became incapacitated and went silent while working a night shift alone in the tower at busy McCarran International Airport in Las Vegas. KLAS-TV has the story.

articles.description: Firefighters in California are battling the most destructive wildfires in state's history. KCBS reporter Greg Mills joined CBSN to discuss the latest on the ground, and contributing meteorologist Jeff Berardelli discussed how high winds fueled the deadly flam…

articles.author: Ed Leefeldt
articles.title: Kelley Blue Book reveals best new cars for 2019
articles.description: Volvo XC40 takes the No. 1 spot among subcompact luxury SUVs -- and pulls in as the top auto value overall, too
articles.content: Volvo's XC40 may not be the hottest, fastest or most aerodynamic four-wheeler. But out of more than 300 new models, Kelley Blue Book just named the subcompact luxury SUV as the 2019 model year's best offering in that category and the overall "best new model."… [+3802 chars]

articles.title: Trump defends pick for acting attorney general
articles.description: President Trump has spent the past few days trying to distance himself from his new acting attorney general while also praising him. Dan Balz, chief correspondent for the Washington Post, joins CBSN to discuss Matthew Whitaker's appointment.

articles.description: Sen. Lindsey Graham, R-South Carolina, discusses President Trump’s relationship with European allies and his belief that acting Attorney General Matt Whitaker will not interfere in the Mueller investigation.

articles.title: Trump commemorates 100 years since end of World War I in Paris
articles.description: President Trump honored those who served in World War I, on the 100th anniversary of the war's end. He delivered remarks at the Suresnes American Cemetery just outside Paris on Nov. 11, 2018.

articles.title: Cruz: "Reason to be concerned" in Florida recount
articles.description: Sen. Ted Cruz, R-Texas, discusses the vote recounts in Florida’s statewide elections and President Trump’s order restricting asylum-seekers at the border with Margaret Brennan.

articles.description: Wildfires are still burning across Northern and Southern California, forcing tens of thousands from their homes. The death toll now stands at 25. Jamie Yuccas reports from the Pacific Ocean enclave of Malibu.

articles.title: Florida begins recounting votes for Senate, Governor elections
articles.description: A number of midterm elections still haven't been decided, and in Florida, voters are saying, "Here we go again." Florida Secretary of State Ken Detzner has ordered "machine" recounts in two key races. Kenneth Craig reports.

articles.title: Trump meets with Macron ahead of Armistice Day
articles.description: President Trump is in Paris for events marking 100 years since the end of World War I. Hours after Mr. Trump criticized French President Emmanuel Macron, the two leaders brushed it off. Weijia Jiang reports.
